    • Method Detail

      • tryLogin

        public void tryLogin(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Public method that tries to log in the user with the specified username and password. If the login is successful, the admin page is opened. If the login is unsuccessful, an error message is displayed.
        Parameters:
        event - The ActionEvent that triggered the method. It cannot be null, an ActionEvent object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if event is null.

      • openRegisterPage

        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if event is null.

      • tryRegister

        public void tryRegister(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Public method that tries to register the user with the specified username, password, and confirm password. If the registration is successful, a success message is displayed. If the registration is unsuccessful, an error message is displayed.
        Parameters:
        event - The ActionEvent that triggered the method. It cannot be null, an ActionEvent object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if event is null.

      • showPopupInfo

        public void showPopupInfo(javafx.stage.Stage ownerStage,
                          java.lang.String message)
        Public method that displays an information popup with the specified message.
        Parameters:
        ownerStage - The Stage that will own the popup. It cannot be null, a Stage object.
        message - The message to be displayed in the popup. It cannot be null or empty, a String object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if ownerStage or message are null or empty.

      • showPopupYoN

        public boolean showPopupYoN(javafx.stage.Stage ownerStage,
                            java.lang.String message)
        Public method that displays a yes or no popup with the specified message.
        Parameters:
        ownerStage - The Stage that will own the popup. It cannot be null, a Stage object.
        message - The message to be displayed in the popup. It cannot be null or empty, a String object.
        Returns:
        true if the user clicks yes, false if the user clicks no or if an error occurs, a boolean.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if ownerStage or message are null or empty.
